locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the 'Good Shepherd' imagery, contrasting sentimental Sunday-school views with the Old Testament context of Ezekiel 34 and the Christological claim of unity with the Father.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. Connects the Johannine 'I Am' to Ezekiel's prophecy and the socio-political reality of power/powerlessness.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily 'asserts' the meaning of the text and 'expresses' personal distaste for sentimentality, moving toward 'promising' only in the final third.
voorbeelden: I am the good shepherd (Quoting Jesus)
Power and love are the two things people can’t do without
The Good Shepherd is not dead

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from a sentimental understanding to a robust trust in Christ's power over death.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The sermon mentions the 'living Word' but does not explicitly invoke the Spirit's agency in the hearing.

voorbeelden: The shepherd image was deeply embedded in the living faith of Israel.
It means that ultimate power and ultimate love are united in one person.
Americans today have such a poor knowledge of our own history.
Listen to this crucial passage from Ezekiel
Do you see how the love...
I thought, oh, darn it, sheep again.
I was thrilled because it was in Eastertide.
He is alive and speaking tenderly to you this very morning.
He alone is the loving and powerful One who is able to secure the safety... of his beloved children.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High theological quality but often framed as descriptions of God's ability rather than direct 'I promise you' acts.

voorbeelden: The dominion of Death is blown to bits on Easter Day.
Acknowledge, we beseech thee, a sheep of thine own fold (Liturgical quote).
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the liturgy and the quoted Scripture to perform the declaration.

indicatoren: Personal anecdotes about cousins in Philadelphia
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually persuaded but remains an observer of the 'Good Shepherd' concept for the majority of the time.

missende_elementen: Direct second-person address of the promise (Toezegging)
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' only happens in the final paragraphs.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strongly grounded in the 'I Am' sayings, but often mediated through quotes.
voorbeelden: The Good Shepherd is... speaking tenderly to you this very morning.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation, mostly at the end.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to connect the Shepherd's voice to the 'now' of the morning.

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a teaching/lecture atmosphere for the first 10 minutes.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about power and love.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from the Assertive (Exegesis of Ezekiel) to the Commissive (Christ's promise) to the Declarative (Liturgical commendation).
voorbeelden: He is alive and speaking tenderly to you... Receive him into the arms of thy mercy.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late but powerful.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because he has power to take life again, we are committed to his care.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a high-level teaching that culminates in a comforting promise. It avoids legalism but spends much time in the 'constative' realm of explanation.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Ultimate power and ultimate love are united in one person.
sterke_punten.effect: Establishes a firm objective ground for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The story about cousins Sylvia and Frederic.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Takes up significant space without adding illocutionary force.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final third when the preacher stops 'talking about' the shepherd and starts 'announcing' his presence to the 'you' in the pews.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Strongest during the liturgical quote at the end where the language becomes inherently performative.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, Christ is described as 'speaking tenderly to you'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Partially; the preacher acts as a witness to the Word.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Good Shepherd is... speaking tenderly to you this very morning.

sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, regarding the 'dominion of Death blown to bits'.
tekstueel_bewijs: He alone is the loving and powerful One who is able to secure...

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is/was' verbs in the first half. Shift to 'gives/promises/speaks' earlier.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The shepherd image was deeply embedded in the living faith of Israel.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, this Shepherd stands among you, calling you by name as He called Israel.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from historical description to present encounter.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often quoted from the Bible rather than spoken by the preacher as a mandate.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use more 'I' (as Christ's ambassador) to 'You' language.
voorbeeldzinnen: In Christ's name, I tell you: no one shall snatch you out of His hand.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply theological and comforting sermon that successfully bridges exegesis and pastoral care, though it takes a long 'constative' detour before reaching the performative 'event'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT identifies the 'Declarative' power of the Word to change the hearer's status before God, which SvT's psychological model cannot capture.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade; SAT seeks to 'do' something (bless, promise, forgive) through the speech act itself.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is concentrated in the final 20% where the illocutionary force shifts from Assertive to Commissive.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The Good Shepherd is not dead. He is alive and speaking tenderly to you this very morning.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: This is the 'hinge' of the sermon where it becomes an event.

appendices.notities: The use of the Prayer of Commendation at the end provides a strong liturgical-performative finish that compensates for the earlier constative surplus.
